description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dv83","text":"This recipe is used to culture algae of the genus Ulothrix in the lab. However, in can be used to grow other organisms such as cyanobacteria, chrysophyta, euglenophyta and other green algae.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":50,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
document: {"blocks":[{"key":"68sqh","text":"Bristol’s Modified Medium","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7m6ld","text":"Author: Kristel Sánchez","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fki8b","text":"This recipe is based on Flinn Scientific, Inc Bristol’s Modified Medium (BMM) recipe.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":24,"length":60}],"data":{}},{"key":"8bs82","text":"Summary","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"984lb","text":"This recipe is used to culture algae of the genus Ulothrix in the lab. However, in can be used to grow other organisms such as cyanobacteria, chrysophyta, euglenophyta and other green algae.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":50,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fgkf","text":"Materials","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6a08a","text":" Apparatus & Equipment Labware Reagents Autoclave 500 mL polyethylene bottles Sodium nitrate, NaNO3 Aluminum foil Graduated cylinder Calcium chloride, CaCl2•2H2O Autoclave tape 500 mL beakers Magnesium Sulfate, MgSO4•7H2O Analytical balance Stirring magnet Potassium phosphate dibasic, K2HPO4 Weight boats or paper 5L glass aspirator bottle Potassium phosphate monobasic, KH2PO4 Rubber cap for 5L Sodium chloride, NaCl Rubber hose UTEX GR+/NH4 Medium soil water spatula Iron (III) chloride, FeCl3 ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":681}],"data":{}},{"key":"47jfj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hvpu","text":"Primary Stock Solutions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evm43","text":"These solutions are prepared by dissolving the prescribed amount of chemical into 400mL of MilliQ water. Store these solutions in polyethylene bottles at 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bs9me","text":" Compound Symbol Grams (g) Final concentration mg/L Sodium nitrate NaNO3 10 0.025 Calcium chloride CaCl2•2H2O 1 0.0025 Magnesium sulfate MgSO4•7H2O 3 0.0075 Potassium phosphate dibasic K2HPO4 3 0.0075 Potassium phosphate monobasic KH2PO4 7 0.0175 Sodium chloride NaCl 1 0.0025 ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":432}],"data":{}},{"key":"fe6kt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83bkb","text":"1% Iron chloride solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dm6ih","text":"Combine 1g of iron (III) chloride in 100mL of MilliQ water. Store in polyethylene bottle at 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1p14k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"852dc","text":"Final solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"170r3","text":"Obtain an aspirator bottle that has a rubber hose and clamp already attached to it and add 1000 mL of MilliQ water. Next, add 50 mL of each primary stock solution into the aspirator media culture bottle. Add five drops of 1% iron (III) chloride solution and 200mL of soil water. Fill the bottler until the 5L mark with MilliQ water. Place the rubber stopper laterally (so it does not completely plug the top opening of the aspirator bottle) and completely cover the top with aluminum foil. Cover the end of the rubber hose with aluminum foil (or connect it to the second aspirator bottle if setting up a new culture).Autoclave the mixture by selecting program number 2 in the autoclaves found in the 4 or 5thfloor of the BSB building (or at 121 °C for 15 min). Once autoclave program has run, remove the bottles carefully from autoclave using the autoclave gloves. Let the liquid and bottles to cool down before using.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":706,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rivh","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52uq6","text":"
